citation.article-title: Selective isolation and characterisation of members of the Streptomyces violaceusniger clade associated with the roots of Paraserianthes falcataria.

p.s: Description of Streptomyces javensis sp. nov.
Streptomyces javensis (ja. ven'sis. N.L. adj. javensis pertaining to Java, Indonesia)
Spore chains are Spirales; the spore surface is rugose.
On oatmeal agar the spore mass is gray, the substrate mycelium grayish-yellow and the diffusible pigment yellow.
The organism degrades xylan and does not grow at 45 Â°C; other phenotypic properties are shown in Table 4.
The strain was isolated from non-rhizosphere soil adjacent to a stand of the tropical legume, Paraserianthes falcataria.
The type strain is B22P3 (= DSM41764 = NCIMB 13679).
